We don't copy the bits into the bitmap that GeckoSoftwareLayerClient holds (nor do we want to).
We should be able to just pass whatever bitmap we want to use in to nsWindow::DrawTo() for screenshots.
I thought that's how it worked, actually...
You send this to JS and send it back to Java but you don't use it in processThumbnail.
"id" -> "tabID" to be consistent with other messages
>+    void processThumbnail(Tab thumbnailTab, Bitmap bitmap, byte[] compressed) {
You could check this right away and return, right?
BitmapFactory.decodeByteArray is not cheap even for white bitmaps.
You don't want Tabs.getInstance().selectTab(tabId), you want Tabs.getInstance().getTab(tabId)
I wonder if this should be on the background thread?
SessionSnapshotRunnable already calls processThumbnail on the background thread, right?
Do you really want to call copyPixelsFromMultiTileLayer for a SingleTileLayer?
>+                    Log.w(LOGTAG, "getBitmap() called on a layer (" + mTileLayer + ") we don't know how to get a bitmap from");
You mentioned returning null for a gralloc case
Could you split this function so most of it lives in Tab?
Add a method called Tab.screenshot(aWidth, aHeight) and put the lower section of code in it
Use " instead of ' and add a space after the commas
Test for a valid browser and browser.contentWindow first and return if we don't have it:
And here, but remove this anyway.
You could add the JSON getters here and call Tab.screenshot here, removing BrowserApp.screenshotTab
r- to see a new patch
also, the size of the string being sent over the message could be huge.
not sure what ramifications could exist from that.
